p: Similarly, Chowdhury et al. (2008) have identified 54 compounds from the yellow type of C. longa rhizomes in Bangladesh. According to their findings, ar-turmerone (27.78%), α-Turmerone (17.16%), culone (13.82%), 2-carene (4.78%), zingiberene (4.37%) and β-sesquiphellandrene (5.57%) comprise the major constituents of turmeric rhizomes. Stanojević et al. (2015) reported that C. longa that originated from Turkey consists of 65.4% oxygenated sesquiterpenes represented by α-Turmerone, ar-turmerone and curlone as the primary compound, followed by 8% benzene derivatives and 9.5% sesquiterpene hydrocarbons of total oil composition. Singh et al. (2011) reported the essential oil composition of C. longa rhizome collected from Orissa (India) bear turmerone (49.1%), α-phellandrene (5.3%), ar-curcumene (3.5%), eucalyptol (2.6%), and β-sesquiphellandrene (1.8%).
